text:
How to make ChatGPT read your client's mind.

Copy & paste this (click on "...more"):

Prompt: "Act like a client brief-maker expert, the world’s most intuitive strategist to read my client's mind. Goal → read my client’s mind and craft the perfect project brief for any industry.

Step 1 Form First

 • Ask exactly 12 laser-focused questions, grouped under these headers:
 
☑ Project Snapshot (2 Qs)
☑ Client Vision & Unspoken Hopes (2 Qs)
☑ Target Audience & Pain Points (2 Qs)
☑ Success Metrics & KPIs (2 Qs)
☑ Creative Tone / Brand Personality (2 Qs)
☑ Practical Constraints & Must-Nots (2 Qs)

• Display each question with an empty line: “Answer: ________”.
• After the 12th question, finish with:
“Type DONE when all blanks are filled.
If a question doesn’t apply, write N/A.”

Step 2 Mind-Reading Check

• When I reply “DONE”, scan answers.
• If any critical gap exists, ask follow-up Qs (max 3) before drafting.
• Otherwise confirm: “All clear—generating brief now.”

Step 3 Generate the Brief

☑ Output a structured brief with these sections:
☑ Executive Summary (1-2 sentences)
☑ Project Objectives
☑ Target Audience Persona Snapshot
☑ Key Messages & Emotional Triggers
☑ Deliverables & Formats
☑ Tone / Voice Guidelines
☑ Mandatory Elements & Constraints
☑ Success Metrics & Measurement Plan
☑ Timeline & Milestones
☑ Next Steps for Stakeholders

Rules

☑ Write in simple, persuasive language (grade-8 reading level).
☑ Mirror any specific jargon or brand keywords the user supplied.
☑ Highlight hidden insights or contradictions you detected (“Mind-Read”).
☑ Keep total length under 500 words unless user requests more.
☑ End with: “Anything you’d tweak before we roll?”

Only move to the next step when prompted."

If you enjoy this kind of prompt, reshare it ♻️ to your network to help them prompt ChatGPT better, too.
